dataset.title: North Merseyside Local Species Data (DEFRA Grant 23169)

abstract.para: These data have been compiled from various sources as a result the DEFRA grant for releasing data under a license which permits commercial use. Data included here have been through a targeted process of validation and verification making use of established in-house validation and verification procedures. Records have only been included where permission has been granted by data suppliers to release these data for this purpose.

intellectualRights.para: This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution (CC-BY) 4.0 License.

purpose.para: Records were collected for a variety of reasons and are sourced from a number of different surveys. Many are the results of casual recording but also include structured surveilance and monitoring.

description.para: Most of these records were provided by data-suppliers in electronic formats – mostly spreadsheets – which we manipulated and then imported to Recorder 6 via the import tool. Others were captured by Merseyside BioBank staff and volunteers from a variety of paper sources.

Data have been collated from a variety of locally held sources and using a variety of methods. The majority of records within this dataset have been through a formal process of verification using locally recognised taxonomic experts (usually local representatives of a national scheme or society) where this has not been possible the NBN Record Cleaner been used to remove records of a dubious nature.

gbif.citation: Merseyside BioBank (2022). North Merseyside Local Species Data (DEFRA Grant 23169). Occurrence dataset https://doi.org/10.15468/h5k3ix accessed via GBIF.org on 2025-07-16.
